name: Google I/O Extended 2018 Carthage
description:
#IMPORTANT#: Please make sure to register here https://bit.ly/2tgFNLL to reserve your place and be eligible for potential free gifts.

Google I/O is an annual event hosted by Google to highlight the latest in technology and product innovation. This covers topics such as the IoT, working with material design, advancements in mobile technology, Machine Learning and so much more.

I/O Extended 2018 is an event that aims to put together the developers community in Tunis to discuss and learn about the new technologies introduced at Google I/O 2018.

We invite you to join GDG CARTHAGE in a cozy and warm atmosphere at "ORANGE DEVELOPER CENTER" to experience the magic and innovation of Google I/O .

Detailed agenda:

14h00 – 14h30 :
Registration

14h30 – 15h00 :
Women Techmakers Presentation
Google Developer Group Presentation
Google I/O

15h00 – 17h00 :
What’s new from Google ?
- Instead of Mobile First, Google is now AI First
- Android P preview
- The Assistant
- The rise of Kotlin (35%) and Flutter
- New Android Studio
- Tensorflow

17h00 – 17h15 :
Coffee Break

17h15 – 18h15 :
Material Design
What’s new from Google (Material Theming)?
What’s new in constraintLayout and Android
Studio Design Tools

18h15 – 18h30 :
Summary Google I/O18
Google Developer Group Program From July to December 2018

18h30 – 19h00 : Let’s talk together

name: GDG Club 'Pilote Ariana' First meeting
description:
In this meeting, we gonna discuss working strategy of GDG Club 'Pilote Ariana' : events and workshops schedule.
In addition , we will plan for DevFest 18 : suggest speakers and subjects.

name: UX Masterclass Powered by GDG
description:
Looking to sharpen your UX skills?
Good news! Local UX/UI Design Thinking instructors with coordination with the local GDGs & Google DevRel, will be conducting a 2-day hands-on user experience masterclass, focused on Design thinking. This is a free event.

We will cover the process of taking product ideas from concept to launch, including sketching, user testing, prototyping, and making continuous improvements after launch to keep your users engaged and satisfied.

Interested? Apply here :
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScIMDD_R7H8s6wxUmbW3uEu5Wp0-jLfC_TuoRSy0zrvHeUKQw/viewform

name: DevFest 18 preparation meeting
description:
In this meeting, we gonna discuss DevFest event and workshop schedule : the plan of the 2 days: sessions , speakers ...GDG Club
In addition , we will plan for launching GDG club.

name: Google Developers Roadshow MENA 2018
description:
The Google Developers Roadshow (GDR) MENA 2018 is a series of interactive conferences, Tech Talks, Hands-on, Workshops, codelabs, hackathon & competitions (With prizes & Swag!), & certificates, providing the latest updates on Google technologies and open platforms for developers and industry leaders.

GDR will be held throughout the year at various cities in Middle East and North Africa.

We're excited to share our thoughts on innovative technologies and encourage developers to build the next big Mobile, Web, IoT, Cloud or Machine Learning solutions.

Come and join us as we travel around MENA.

https://events.withgoogle.com/googledevelopersroadshow/

Detailed agenda:
8:00 - 8.30 : Registration and Networking
8.30 - 8.35 : Partner Keynote
8.35 - 9.10 : Technology Trends, ML, IOT, & Community Empowerment. By Salim Abid
9.10 - 9.50 : Think business, sketch as a designer and code like a gee. By Rayan Al Zahab
9:50 - 10:00 : Ecosystem Round Table / Q&A. With Googlers/GDEs
10.00 - 10.40 : Assistant Study Jam intro. By Abderrahman Omran
10:40 - 10:55 : Break
10.55 - 11.35 : Machine Learning. By Karim Beguir
11:35 - 12.05 : Cloud Study Jam intro. By Abderrahman Omran
12:05 - 12.35 : Web/PWA (Optional). By Abderrahman Omran

name: InstaDeep AI Hackathon

venue.name: École Nationale d'Ingénieurs de Sousse
venue.address_1: Route de Ceinture Sahloul, Cité Hammam Maarouf,

description:
#IMPORTANT#: Please make sure to register here https://bit.ly/2NJ5xrK to reserve your seat. Please select the number of tickets that equals the number of participants in your team. And please make sure that there is one registration per team. Thank you.

Google has been incredibly involved in the democratization of AI in Africa, lately, mainly by opening a Google AI lab in Ghana in the past months. Likewise, InstaDeep, a Tunisian AI startup has been working on the same mission for the past few years, by working extensively in AI research and deploying it in several products.

On November 3rd and 4th, InstaDeep decided to join forces with Google's DevRel program to organize an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Hackathon, in partnership with IEEE ENISo and Gourmandise, at l'Ecole Nationale des Ingenieurs de Sousse.

Join us for 24 hours of food, fun, swag, coding and learning!

The event will happen at ENISo and we welcome everyone to join us from all over Tunisia.

Agenda:

Nov 3rd:
10:00 am: Welcome & coffee
10:30 am: Talk from Salim Abid, Google Developer Ecosystem Regional Lead: MENA - Technology Trends, and communities empowerment
11:15 am: Talk from Karim Beguir, co-founder and CEO of InstaDeep, and explanation of challenge
12:00 pm: Challenge starts

Nov 4th:
12:00 pm: Challenge ends
1:00 pm: Announcement of winners and networking

More details will be communicated to the confirmed participants.

The prizes for the challenge:
- First prize: Internship at InstaDeep + Google Pixel 2
- Second prize: Internship at InstaDeep + Google Daydream View
- Third Prize: Internship at InstaDeep + Google Home Mini

Register NOW at https://bit.ly/2NJ5xrK

Please only register ONCE per team. Do not submit individual submissions for one team.

The maximum number of people allowed in a team is 3 (you + 2 teammates).

Deadline for Registration: October 26th, 2018.

name: UX Café with IxDA, Share your UXperience

venue.name: Level 1
venue.address_1: Boulevard Cheikh Zaid, Les berges du Lac

description:
In partnership with IxDa Tunis, we announce 'UX Café' which is a monthly meeting of enthusiasts and professionals of UX in Tunisia in format of a round table to discuss the latest trends in the field.
The meeting is open to everyone without exception to learn and network with an extraordinary community in the unique setting of our partner LEVEL 1 and the Internet Marketers Meetup.
Book your place and come and share with us your '' UXperience '' by filling this form: https://goo.gl/forms/a6BZqIYT0BluPGKz1 and we will be back to you via email as soon as possible.
Meeting open to all in the limit of available places.

name: GDG DevFest Carthage 2018

venue.name: Mediterranean School of Business
venue.address_1: Les Berges du Lac II Walkway, Tunis

description:
Google Developer Group Carthage DevFest 2018!

The event will be held on November 24th and 25th in the South Mediterranean University MSB, Lac 2, and we welcome everyone to join us for two days of learning, competition, swag, food and fun!

Saturday, we’ll have sessions and workshops focused on Google (and non-Google) technologies. We’ll also kickoff the Hackathon.
Sunday will be a continuation of the Hackathon only!

You will find the detailed agenda of Sessions and Workshops here https://www.gdgcarthage.com/ .

If you plan on attending, please register and fill out the form to customize your schedule! Book your seats on the different sessions and workshops, and be eligible for potential gifts and prizes!

Important to read for Hackathon attendees:

This year's Hackathon will be to build a mobile app in 24 hours. It can be an android, flutter or hybrid app. No websites or PWAs allowed.
Each year, Google DevRel choses a theme for the event, and this year it's "Digital Wellness". So it is recommended that at least one Digital Wellness feature be included in the app.
The theme of the Hackathon will be revealed on the day of the event.

When filling out the registration form, you will notice that you can attend the morning sessions, but once you chose to register for the Hackathon you will not be allowed to select workshops, as both are happening at the same time.

The minimum number of people allowed per group is 3, you can chose to add a 4th person but you have to know that the prizes are planned for groups of 3.

Each team has to choose a name, one person will do the Hackathon registration for all the team members and all the others will only register themselves with the same team name.

More detail about the prizes very soon.

Good luck for everyone and we hope to see you there!

name: Flutter Study Jams 2018

venue.name: Mediterranean School of Business
venue.address_1: Les Berges du Lac II Walkway, Tunis

description:
Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.
Learn how to set up your environment and start building your first Flutter application
Learn about fundamentals: UI Widgets, App State, Material Design, User Interaction and Gestures, and Packages
Learn how to structure and architect your app and use Flutter's tooling to build apps efficiently
Complete the course and get Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

name: Google Hash Code 2019
description:
Hashcode - GDG Carthage

GDG Carthage is proud to organize for the first time, the GDG Carthage Hash-code.

** Stay tuned for more information. **

# Hashcode

Meanwhile check the Hashcode website for registration and more information.

https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode

> Past problem statements
https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode/archive

>Three reasons to participate in Hashcode
https://www.blog.google/technology/developers/three-reasons-to-participate-in-hashcode/

# From the website
What’s involved?
"Hash Code is a team programming competition, organized by Google, for students and professionals around the world. You pick your team and programming language and we pick an engineering problem for you to solve. This year’s contest kicks off with an Online Qualification Round, where your team can compete from wherever you’d like, including from one of our Hash Code hubs. Top teams will then be invited to a Google office for the Final Round."

name: That's all data talks! Session 1
description:
That's all data talks! DaTalks is a community of programmers like you, who are passionate about web technologies, data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. It is a collaborative space for professionals and novices to create and solve problems at the local and international level. We will have talks, open discussions and coding sessions. Data is power learn it, transform it, change the world with it!

Meet the DaTalks on February 7th at 6pm :

Falling in love with Data Science - Firas Baba
Intro to Reinforcement Learning - Amel Sellami
How do Recommender Systems work - Ines Bahri

Get your ticket here : https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/thats-all-data-talks-tickets-55827705169

name: Machine Learning Study Jams 19
description:
New to machine learning but don't know where to start? Join us for a Machine Learning Study Jam.

This course is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable you to use machine learning in your everyday projects and learn about the power of TensorFlow. This is a great opportunity for anyone with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

**overview of the course:

AutoML Vision helps developers with limited ML expertise train high quality image recognition models.

In this lab you will upload images to Cloud Storage and use them to train a custom model to recognize different types of clouds (cumulus, cumulonimbus, etc.).

**What you'll learn:

Uploading a labeled dataset to Google Cloud Storage and connecting it to AutoML Vision with a CSV label file.

Training a model with AutoML Vision and evaluating its accuracy.

Generating predictions on your trained model.

**And what you need is basically some python and shell knowledge

Register here : https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/machine-learning-study-jams-19-tickets-55734022963

** Bring your laptop! **

name: UX Design : Méthodes et pratiques des recherches utilisateurs

venue.name: Ecole Supérieure Des Sciences Et Technologies Du Design

description:
See you on Wednesday 13-02 at the 'Ecole Supérieure des Sciences et Technologies du Design', a session of 'UX Design: Methods and practices of user research', presenting the techniques used for user-centered design, qualitative and quantitative methods, as well as testing practices and user research assessments.
Every One is Welcome to this session.

Aicha Kamoun : Essted
Noha Jaafar : Google Developer Group
Marwen Essalah : IXDA
Ghazi Bouzidi : IXDA

name: Cloud Study Jam
description:
Study Jams are back! Join us on the 17 of February for our Google Cloud Study Jam where we'll be taking on:
-A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform
-Creating a Virtual Machine
-Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
-Provision Services with GCP Marketplace
And at the end of the day you will:
-Get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profile, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud computing.

• What to bring
Notebook, Laptop, An open mind.

Get your ticket here : https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/cloud-study-jam-tickets-56287181475

• Important to know
Please feel free to contact us in case of any questions.

name: Designers meet Developers
description:
Here we go for our next meet-up : "Designers Meet Developers": The secret to keep a development project on track. We have the pleasure to be hosted by Go My Code on Wednesday 20th at 6pm. The meet-up will bring together both the Designers community (UI / UX) and the developer community and will take place Wednesday, February 20, 2019 from 6pm.
During the meet-up, we will discuss the following points:
- The main challenges encountered when developing a development project between a developer and a designer.
- The basic knowledge that a designer and a developer should have in order to facilitate communication between them.
- How to succeed a project: Defining well the expectations of a designer and a developer.
- Space for exchange and feedback of experiences with participants

If you are a designer, developer or student, do not hesitate to reserve your place by filling out the form :
https://www.facebook.com/events/542868229532675/

name: Introduction to UXDesign -
description:
User Experience: What is UX?
More and more people and companies are learning that in order to stay competitive and to be up-to-date, they need to invest in user experience, but they don’t necessarily know what it means neither do we I guess. The good news is, there’s never been a better time to learn about user experience (UX). Whether you are interested in this field, or you just want to learn the principles of UX to create better products, designs, and campaigns, we’re here to help you get started.

A session about UX will take place next wednesday, the 6th of March 2K19, in partnership with GDG Carthage AND IXDA Tunis , we’ll share what UX is with you.

Facebook Event : https://www.facebook.com/events/305552223495822/

P.S : Please fill out the form below :
https://goo.gl/forms/8sWEIk0IUGK31qFK2

#SaveTheDate #JoinUs
#UX #GDGCarthage #IXDATunis #IEEEEnstabSB

name: International Women's Day "IWD" GDG Carthage 2019
description:
GDG Carthage and WTM Carthage are celebrating The ‘International Women's Day’ at Esprit Elghazela.
On March 9th, we will feature some of the women making a change in Tunisia's entrepreneurial landscape.
The theme of this first edition is : 'Empowering women to start their own businesses'. We will host multiple talks by women founders who will share their adventures in the world of entrepreneurship, as well as pitching, design and coding workshops to help get women started on their way to business ownership.
Program:
09:00 am : Regsitration and Breakfast
10:00 am : Welcome Remarks : WTM & GDG Carthage
10:30 am : Keynote
11:00 am : Sucess stories
12:00 am : Lunch and Networking
01:00 pm : Session : The art of pitching
02:00 pm: Session : Personal Branding, Design Tips to start your own career
03:00 Break

04:30 pm : Closing Remarks
To join us, register on : https://bit.ly/2SFrYAA
#WTM19 #WomenTechMakers
#WTM19Carthage #WTM19MENA #GDGCARTHAGE

name: Math and statistics for Data Science - DaTalks Workshop
description:
Do you need to have a math Ph.D to become a data scientist?
Mathematical knowledge is an important skill for a data scientist. But, how much math is really needed to do data science?
Mathematics is a lot of areas such as algebra, analysis and statistics. It is not necessary to know every area in order to apply the different algorithms.
In this Talk, we would specify the areas needed for data science and the different definitions and concepts.
Math is a tool and not a monster to be afraid of

- Linear algebra basics

* Basic properties of matrix and vectors: scalar multiplication, linear transformation, determinant
* Special matrices: square matrix, identity matrix, triangular matrix, idea about sparse and dense matrix, unit vectors
* Eigenvalues, eigenvectors, diagonalization, singular value decomposition

- statistics and probabilities:
* Basic probability: basic idea, expectation, probability calculus, Bayes’ theorem, conditional probability
* Probability distribution functions: uniform, normal, binomial, central limit theorem
* Sampling, measurement, error, random number generation
* Hypothesis testing, A/B testing, confidence intervals, p-values, ANOVA, t-test

Get your ticket here : https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/math-and-statistics-for-data-science-datalks-workshop-tickets-58538401936

name: Spring Dev : UX Design for beginners.
description:
During the spring break, Orange Developer Center gives you the opportunity to boost your skills in web & mobile development and learn new skills in data science.

What you have to do is take part in the free Spring Dev training sessions, which will take place at the Orange Developer Center, from March 18 to 29, which will be provided by experts in development, gaming and design.

Discover the detailed program and book your tickets now by filling out the form below.

UX / UI Design by Noha Jaafar, GDG Carthage Lead
Monday March 18th, from 9h to 13h - from 14h to 17h

You will know the principles of optimization of the customer journey, learn to adapt to new navigation behaviors and arouse the emotions of a user through its device.

In the program:
- The fundamentals of UX
- The UX process
- User search methods
- Customize persona (user profiling)
- Generate features from user needs for your mobile apps or websites

name: TensorFlow Dev Summit 2019 Viewing Party - Tunis
description:
Come join us on April 6th to learn about what's new for TensorFlow, the open source machine learning framework created by Google Brain.
We are going to highlight the technologies and innovations announced at the TensorFlow Dev Summit that happened in Sunnyvale, California on March 6th and 7th.
We will stream the most interesting tech talks from the event and have AI experts for live interactions and questions.

Detailed agenda:

09.00 - 09.30 - General Introduction to tensorFlow - By Rihab Gorsane
09.30 - 10.00 - TensorFlow 2.0 - With Helmi Rebai
10.00 - 10.30 - Datasets and Models - With Youssef Ben Dhieb
10.30 - 11.00 - Coffee Break
11.00 - 11.30 - TensorFlow Hub - With Youssef Ben Dhieb
11.30 - 12.00 - New features in TensorBoard - With Rihab Gorsane
12.00 - 12.30 - TensorFlow.js 1.0 - With Dhiaeddine Gharsall

NB: Please make sure to register here https://bit.ly/2I6l4To to reserve your seat

name: Deep Learning IndabaX Tunisia
description:
The first edition of IndabaX Tunisia will take place the 13th of April 2019 at Sup’Com in Tunis! This event is an opportunity for the Tunisian AI community to meet, discover the most recent advances in the field and interact with world-leading AI researchers. If you are a beginner and curious to learn more or if you are an expert in Machine Learning, you are encouraged to join us and be part of a network fully committed to building the future of AI in Tunisia.

Click here to have more details about the program, the speakers and to register for the event.
➡️ https://www.indabaxtunisia.com/

❗️❗️The deadline to submit applications is March 25, 2019 and the places are limited ❗️❗️
